definition: to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity

a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness

sentences.english: Gambling shavings inadvertently found that the beneficiary on SunQiMing policy turned out to be yourself.

sentences.english: In China, however, tooting the horn seems to have two other meanings.
sentences.chinese: 但在中國，鳴喇叭似乎有兩種別的意思。

sentences.english: SunQiMing cannot bear to see, he came near and comfort on the girl.

sentences.english: In honour of the distinguished guest they let off a salute of 21 guns.
sentences.chinese: 爲向貴賓表示敬意，他們鳴禮炮21響。

sentences.english: They fired a salute of ten guns.
When encountering somebody herding animals and obstructing the traffic, the driver should continuously honk to warn.

sentences.english: SunQiMing come on them, says he is serious this time.
sentences.chinese: 孫啓鳴拜託他們，說自己這次是認真的。

sentences.english: In the middle of the night the drums suddenly beat to arms.
sentences.chinese: 半夜裏突然戰鼓鳴，傳令準備戰鬥。

sentences.english: A bird was warbling in a window cage.
sentences.chinese: 一隻鳥兒在窗前懸掛的籠子裏囀鳴。

sentences.english: Narumi thinks that Mikan holds the key to save Natsume and change the Academy.

sentences.english: KangShu also let community shavings of concern once SunQiMing.

sentences.english: SunQiMing come over, everyone comfort up him, let him my condolences.
sentences.chinese: 孫啓鳴過來了，大家都安慰起來他，讓他節哀順便。

sentences.english: They saluted the Queen by firing ten guns.
sentences.chinese: 他們鳴禮炮十響向女王致敬。

sentences.english: The band played the national anthems of both countries and fired 21 gun salutes.
sentences.chinese: 樂隊高奏中美兩國國歌，禮炮鳴21響。

sentences.english: The military band played the national anthems of the two countries and a 19-gun salute was fired.
sentences.chinese: 軍樂隊奏中南兩國國歌，鳴禮炮19響。

sentences.english: A 41 gun saluted in London's Hyde Park by the king's troop royal horse artillery.
sentences.chinese: 英國乘騎炮兵在倫敦海德公園鳴41炮製經。
